quotes.text: Reflect on your present blessings, of which every man has many; not on your past misfortunes, of which all men have some.
quotes.author: Charles Dickens

quotes.text: Gratitude is riches. Complaint is poverty.
quotes.author: Doris Day

quotes.text: Gratitude is the fairest blossom which springs from the soul.
quotes.author: Henry K. Beecher

quotes.text: Gratitude is not only the greatest of virtues, but the parent of all the others.
quotes.author: Cicero

quotes.text: Gratitude makes sense of our past, brings peace for today, and creates a vision for tomorrow.
quotes.author: Melody Beattie

quotes.text: I would maintain that thanks are the highest form of thought, and that gratitude is happiness doubled by wonder.
quotes.author: G. K. Chesterton

quotes.text: As we express our gratitude, we must never forget that the highest appreciation is not to utter words, but to live by them.
quotes.author: John F. Kennedy

quotes.text: Happiness cannot be travelled to, owned, earned, worn or consumed. Happiness is the spiritual experience of living every minute with love, grace and gratitude.
quotes.author: Denis Waitley

quotes.text: We should all be thankful for those people who rekindle the inner spirit.
quotes.author: Albert Schweitzer

quotes.text: Talent is God-given; be humble. Fame is man-given; be thankful. Conceit is self-given; be careful.
quotes.author: Harvey Mackay

quotes.text: Appreciation is the highest form of prayer, for it acknowledges the presence of good wherever you shine the light of your thankful thoughts.
quotes.author: Alan Cohen
